sec.div: Urbanization and feather CORT levels (11 sites)
sec.p: Feather CORT levels were significantly and positively correlated with urbanization score (LMM: t = 3.79, p = 0.004; Figure 2). Feather CORT levels were in mean 19.45% higher in the most urban site relative to the most rural site. Feather CORT levels were not explained by the capture date ( t = −0.03, p = 0.974).

div.p: Relationship between the degree of urbanization and feather CORT level expressed in ng/mg in juvenile sparrows. The line represents a significant relationship between feather CORT level and urbanization score
